summary.notes: Batch 08 shows mixed quality typical of scholarly philosophical texts. GOOD pages have error rates 2.2-2.6%. MARGINAL pages range 3.0-5.0% with recoverable meaning despite OCR artifacts. BAD pages (327, 346, 348, 351) show critical character corruption and Unicode issues affecting Greek/Latin terminology, particularly problematic for philosophy. Footnote markers consistently preserved but sometimes with spacing corruption (e.g., '[z48)', '[2 7o)'). German philosophical terms (Dasein, Sein, Wesen, Gestalt) generally well-preserved except in BAD pages. Most impactful errors are Unicode character corruptions in Greek transliterations and occasional word-level substitutions (vhat/what, hoever/whoever).
